scientific_basis: Derived from PINN principles (Raissi, Perdikaris, Karniadakis) for approximating solutions to nonlinear PDEs governing fluid dynamics and wave propagation, generating fully differentiable surrogate models.

curriculum_stages.description: Standard container manipulation; slow movements; focus on joint torque control and stable fluid configuration (laminar flow).
High-velocity maneuvers designed to induce shock wave formation and significant sloshing (Burgers-like non-linearity) necessary for PINN training on discontinuities.

parameters.notes: Generates data rich in non-linearity and potential discontinuities/shocks, crucial for training physics-informed surrogate models.

curriculum_stages.description: Testing mechanical stability and energy dissipation under high turbulence (Navier-Stokes regime) and extreme friction variation.

parameters.notes: Focuses on explicit physics failures: high friction loss leading to excessive energy dissipation and highly turbulent flow fields (maximum data entropy).
